goal.core.agent

Class Agent<CONTROLLER extends Controller>

  • java.lang.Object
    • goal.core.agent.Agent<CONTROLLER>
  • Type Parameters:
    CONTROLLER - a subclass of Controller used to control the agent.

    public class Agent<CONTROLLER extends Controller>
extends java.lang.Object
    Generic representation of an agent in the GOAL runtime environment. An agent consist of an identity, the ability to act and perceive its an environment through and the ability to communicate with other agents. What the agent does is controlled by a Controller. The Controller starts a process that can be used by subclasses to drive the agents actions. This process can be stopped, started and reset through the agent. During these operations the agent should stay connected to to the environment and messaging. At the end of the Agents life the dispose method should be called to clean up any resources claimed by the agent.

        public Agent(AgentId id,
     EnvironmentCapabilities environment,
     MessagingCapabilities messaging,
     LoggingCapabilities logger,
     CONTROLLER controller)
      throws KRInitFailedException
        Creates new agent.
        Parameters:
        id - unique identity of the agent
        environment - capabilities for the environment in which the agent is situated
        messaging - capabilities of the agent
        controller - that controls the agent
        logger - a logger for LogActions.
        Throws:
        KRInitFailedException - when the agent could not initialize the KRLanguage

      • reset

        public void reset()
           throws java.lang.InterruptedException,
                  KRInitFailedException
        Resets the agents controller. The agents procces is stopped, once the agent has stopped its internal state will be reset.
        Throws:
        java.lang.InterruptedException - when interrupted while waiting for the agent to stop
        KRInitFailedException - when failing to reset the KRlanguage.
